description.narrative: The Agricultural Value Chain Collaborative Research initiative will deliver significant and equitable benefits to the rural poor, particularly women living in Punjab and Sindh through functional improvements in targeted agriculture value chains (AVC). This will be achieved through: Collaborative Research; Poor Farmer/Land Holder Adoption of Improvement Management Practices; Private Sector Adoption of Improved Value Chain Practices; and Delivery of Research. Four collaborative AVC research projects will be commissioned by ACIAR, of which the AVC Project Components are: dairy/dairy Meat; goat meat; pulses; and high value vegetables (onions, chillies and tomatoes). The investment is aligned to the substantial investment made over the past ten years through the Australian funded Agriculture Sector Linkages Program (ASLP) which concluded in September 2015. The investment is a new program that will target new opportunities across the selected AVCs. These AVCs have been purposefully selected
